gameFiles

Class PseudoPaddle

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameFiles.ObstacleLine
      • gameFiles.PseudoPaddle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Obstacle

    public class PseudoPaddle
extends ObstacleLine
    The paddle controlled by the user to prevent the ball from falling into the gutter
    Version:
    v4.0 June 12th, 2014
    Author:
    Jason P'ng

    • Constructor Detail

      • PseudoPaddle

        public PseudoPaddle(double x1,
                    double y1,
                    double length,
                    java.awt.Color color)
        The constructor of the paddle setting the x and y coordinates and the length and colour
        Parameters:
        double - x1 the x coordinate of the left point of the line.
        double - y1 the y coordinate of the left point of the line.
        double - length the length of the paddles
        Color - color the colour of the line.

    • Method Detail

      • getMoveSpeed

        public float getMoveSpeed()
        returns the speed of the paddle
        Returns:
        the speed of the paddle

      • updatePos

        public void updatePos(double x)
        Update the position of the paddle. It is restricted to not go past the slopes of the game.
        if (x < 100) - restricts the paddle on the left side.
        else if (x + length > 300) - restricts the paddle on the right side.
        Parameters:
        double - x the new x location

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Implemented method for adding control to the paddle. This allows the speed to be changed using the right and left arrow keys.
        Swith statement is used to distinguish between right and left.
        Parameters:
        KeyEvent - e the keyevent that triggers this method to be called
        int - key the key code of the keyEvent to recognize which key was pressed.
